chapter.title: Effects
chapter.para: You may directly inherit by <ags/audio/ags_recall.h> to do some wicked stuff. But generally you should inherit by these subclasses of AgsRecall:
You probably wish to have different context for fields of an effect, that's what these objects take on. But before we cover them in detail, we take a look at the lifecycle an effect must accomplish.

sect1.title: Play/recall context
sect1.para: Don't mix this context up with static/runtime context we talked before. The AgsRecall may have two faces or may be just one for play context.
The play context will be called in case the higher level of AgsRecycling will output to a device e.g. the soundcard and no further processing will be done.

The recall context means that the AgsRecall will pass one or more cycles of copying or sequencing. This design is intended to make ags as modular and reusable over different use cases as possible. Practically it should be possible to chain up several sequencers.

sect1.title: Hands-On instantiating an effect
sect1.para: After you got an overview of the basic lifecycle of an effect it's time to create an effect. In this guide we will cover instatiating an effect by using the echo effect. In the following chapter we'll take a look inside the echo effect.

sect2.title: AgsRecallContainer
sect2.para: AgsRecallContainer isn't a recall itself but you can use it to retrieve a different context.

sect2.title: AgsRecallAudio context
sect2.para: This is a context you want to use for fields applicable to the entire AgsAudio object.

sect2.title: AgsRecallChannel context
sect2.para: This context you can use for fields applicable to the AgsChannel you want to modify.

sect2.title: AgsRecallAudioRun context
sect2.para: The AgsRecallAudioRun class will be duplicated for a parental running AgsChannel. There may be several AgsChannel objects as parental owning a run.

sect2.title: AgsRecallChannelRun context
sect2.para: The AgsRecallChannelRun behaves like an AgsRecallAudioRun but is designated to an AgsChannel object.

sect1.title: The basic lifecycle of an effect
sect1.para: In this section I'll introduce the keyword run which can be understood as a playing instance. But I rather talk about run because it's not guaranted that the recall outputs directly to a device.
